name: 許益瑞
objective: The course will be started from the brief review of senior high school level of chemistry. Then, the modern quantum chemistry will be introduced to make students familiarized the modern chemistry approach on the interpretation of the physical chemistry phenomena in material and biological science. This includes the introduction to quantum world, Schrödinger equation, chemical bonding, molecular shape and structure and so on. Later, the thermodynamics be applied to the interpretation of physical and chemical equilibrium, acids and bases, aqueous equilibrium and electrochemistry.
schedule:
week 1   Quantum Mechanics and Atomic Structure(Review)
week 2   Quantum Mechanics and Molecular Structure(I)
week 3   Quantum Mechanics and Molecular Structure(II)
week 4   Bonding in Organic Molecules(I)
week 5   Bonding in Organic Molecules(II)
week 6   Bonding in Transition Metal Compounds(I)
week 7   Bonding in Transition Metal Compounds(II)
week 8   The Gaseous State(I)
week 9   The Gaseous State(II)
week 10  Solid, Liquids, Phase Transitions, and Chemical Equilibrium
week 11  Thermodynamic Processes and Thermochemistry(I)
week 12  Thermodynamic Processes and Thermochemistry(II)
week 13  Spontaneous Processes and Thermodynamic Equilibrium(I)
week 14  Spontaneous Processes and Thermodynamic Equilibrium(II)
week 15  Electrochemistry(I)
week 16  Electrochemistry(II)
week 17  Chemical Kinetics(I)
week 18  Chemical Kinetics(II)
scorePolicy:
期中考： 45%
期末考： 45%
平時考： 10%
materials:
Textbook : David W. Oxtoby, H.P. Gillis, Alan Campion, Hatem H. Helal, Kelly P. Gaither, Principles of Modern Chemistry, 7th ed., 2012, Brooks/Cole CENGAGE Learning
Reference: 1. Martin S. Silberberg, CHEMISTRY- The Molecular Nature of Matter and Change 5th ed. 
2. Peter Atkins and Loretta Jones, Chemical Principles, 5th ed.
